replies.bodyText:
The provided link is about the Connection Timeout.  This timer bound execution is for limiting the max whole-request time, for which there is not an available setting on HttpClient API. This approach follows a recommended strategy for aborting the request with a hard time limit from some technical articles about HttpClient usage.
Connection and Socket data packet timeout configuration is provided on the GETMAPKVPREQUESTREADER_TIMEOUT global setting and sets the connection and socket timeout in the HttpClient API since it's available.
replies.author: fernandor777

replies.bodyText: Got it, it's similar to the WMS request limits. Good idea to have this one too, to avoid a variant of a slow DOS attack (the response is given, just to very slowly that the full SLD returns in hours or more, e.g., one char every few minutes)
